title: Amplification and Pooling

authors.name: Franziska Aron
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History

authors.name: Guido Brandt
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History

source.description:
Prepare amplification assay [
]
Based on the quantification results of the indexed libaries (
https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bakticwn
) calculate the number of PCR cycles (amplification factor) needed to reach 10^13 copies of DNA per indexed Library.
Example: The following calculation is for
per reaction, with two indexed library samples (A and B) having different concentrations of DNA copies.
Optonial Changes: 1.If the Calculation shows up less then 3 Cycles, you also have the Option to add less then 5 µl.
2. Instead of 4 reactions of 5 µl each you can also split in 8 reactions of 2 µl each
Instead of 4 x 5 µl reactions you can also split in 8 x 2 µl reactions
ABCDEFGH
1Sample NameCopies per µlµl per rxnCopies per rxnCycles neededReal CyclesAmplification FactorOutput per rxn [Copies]
2A7.32E+1053.66E+114.7729985321.17E+13
3B5.79E+0652.32E+0718.72018251195242881.21E+13

source.body:
Formula in Excel to get the Cycles needed
=LOG((1*10^13/Copies per rxn),2)
(log base 2)

source.description:
ABCDEFGH
1Sample NameCopies per µlµl per rxnCopies per rxnCycles neededReal CyclesAmplification FactorOutput per rxn [Copies]
2A7.32E+1053.66E+114.7729985321.17E+13
3B5.79E+0652.32E+0718.72018251195242881.21E+13

source.body: Do not calculate the amount of cycles for a higher amount of copies than 1.4 *10^13 to avoid heteroduplexes.

source.body:
Adjust the number of cycles according to the amplification factor as calculated in step 1.
During this incubation take MinElute columns out of the fridge so they warm up to room temperature before use in the next step.
This is an ideal point to prepare downstream steps, including labelling of final elution tubes, MinElute Columns etc.

source.description:
Purify with MinElute kit with the following modifications to the manufacturer's protocol:
Use one column for all four reactions [=
PCR product] of a sample.

Dilute amplified index library 1:10 with HPLC- water and check for fragment size, concentration, and heteroduplexes. (for example with the D1000 Kit's Tape, Reagent and Buffer - following the manufacturer's protocol on the TapeStation)

source.body:
if you see heteroduplexes you need to perform a reconditoning PCR.
Reconditoning PCR: one cycle PCR using 100 ng library template in a 100 µl Herculase PCR reaction (same set up as in 3) and amplified with 1 cycles of 95°C for 2 min, 58°C for 2 min, and 72°C for 5 min. Purify with MinElute kit following the instructions from Step 5, but elute in 20µl EBT.

source.description:
Dilute each amplified indexed library to
with EBT buffer or HPLC-water for shotgun sequencing. Then pool the
amplified indexed libraries in equimolar amounts (take the same volume for each sample).

source.body: The final concentration of a pool of several amplfied indexed libraries should be .

Vortex master mix before adding the enzyme. After adding the enzyme, mix by pipetting or inverting the tube.

Pipette
mastermix and
indexed library into each tube (use
PCR strips).

source.body: Keep the remaining library at until further use.

source.description:
Add
PB or PBI* buffer to a
tube for each sample (this is
buffer for each PCR reaction). Add all 4 PCR reactions per sample to the same tube with PB buffer and vortex briefly.

source.body: After the PCR product is mixed with the PBI, the PBI should keep its yellow colour. If it turns purple the pH is too high and the efficency of the MinElute columns is not guaranteed.

source.description:
Add
PE (wash) buffer, spin
, and discard flow-through.

Add
EBT buffer to the center of the filter, incubate for
, and spin
to elute the amplified indexed library.

source.body: Carefully pipette EBT directly onto the center of the membrane without touching the membrane.

source.description: Repeat loading until the complete mixture was run through the column.

Load
of the mixture onto one MinElute column, incubate for
, spin
, and discard flow-through.

source.body: Pour off the liquid into a waste tube, and pat the rim of the collection tube dry on a paper tissue or towel. Use just one spot on the paper tissue per sample. Be careful not to touch the rim of the tube on the waste container. After you are finished with all samples, discard the paper and wipe clean the surface underneath with water and soap.

library or the
library pool for the correct concentration, (for example with the HighSensitivity D1000 Kit's Tape, Reagent and Buffer following the manufacturer's protocol on the TapeStation.)
Prepare cleaned workspace with all necessary reagents and equipment.

source.body: Label all PCR strips for the PCR reactions.

materials.name: Eppendorf Tubes® 5.0 mL with snap cap
Sodium Acetate buffer solution 3M pH 52 for molecular biology

description: This protocol describes the amplification procedure of dual-indexed double-stranded DNA libraries, for shotgun Illumina sequencing. It is typically used for libraries indexed using the following protocol: (https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bakticwn)
